Title: Point
Description: Point is represented by its X and Y coordinates, stored as a Tuple(Float64, Float64).
Examples:
CREATE TABLE geo_point (p Point) ENGINE = Memory();INSERT INTO geo_point VALUES((10, 10));
SELECT p, toTypeName(p) FROM geo_point;

Title: Ring
Description: Ring is a simple polygon without holes stored as an array of points: Array(Point).

Title: LineString
Description: LineString is a line stored as an array of points: Array(Point).

Title: MultiLineString
Description: MultiLineString is multiple lines stored as an array of LineString: Array(LineString).

Title: Polygon
Description: Polygon is a polygon with holes stored as an array of rings: Array(Ring). First element of outer array is the outer shape of polygon and all the following elements are holes.

Title: MultiPolygon
Description: MultiPolygon consists of multiple polygons and is stored as an array of polygons: Array(Polygon).

Title: Geometry
Description: Geometry is a common type for all the types above. It is equivalent to a Variant of those types.
